title: SB 1.17.38 part 3 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 19-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyanan Janashalakaya
Chakshur Unmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshthaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Srivasa Adi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devi Saraswati Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we continue to discuss from the 38th verse of the 17th chapter of the
first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This session will be part 3 of the discussion on the 38th verse.
Previous two sessions we discussed different aspects of this four sinful activities.
Deutam Panam Striya Suna.
Gambling.
And drinking liquor.
And then illicit connection with women and animal slaughter.
Animal killing for the sake of eating the animal flesh.
These four sinful activities we discussed in the previous two sessions.
Prabhupada now is in the last part of this purport he is describing what is the duty
of the executioner.
The duty of the executioner is to protect the executive heads of state to actually counteract
this evil influence of Kali so that there is religiosity which is Dharma is protected
in the state.
So Prabhupada says following in the footsteps of Maharaj Pariksit it is the duty of all
executive heads of states to see that the principles of religion namely austerity, cleanliness,
mercy and truthfulness, tapasyaucham, dayasatyam are established in the state and that the
principles of irreligion namely pride, illicit female association of prostitution, intoxication
and falsity are checked by all means.
So the four principles of religion Dharma to uphold Dharma, Dharma stands on four pillars
that means there has to be austerity, cleanliness, mercy and truthfulness.
Then only there is Dharma.
Dharma is not based on some sentimental following of some so called religious principles.
No.
There is no such thing which each person may think according to me this is Dharma, according
to somebody else something else is Dharma, no.
These are universal factual principles of Dharma which is applicable for the entire
human society, entire human society irrespective of what somebody's belief system may be or
some traditional affiliation to some community or caste or whatever.
Okay.
Or religion, so called religion maybe irrespective of that.
So Akshaya La Prabhupada says to make the best use of a bad bargain, the personality of Kali
may be transferred to places of gambling, drinking, prostitution and slaughterhouses
if there are any places like that.
So Kali Purusha has entered the kingdom of Pariksit.
But Pariksit doesn't want to enter the kingdom of Pariksit.
But Pariksit doesn't want to enter the kingdom of Pariksit.
But Pariksit doesn't want Kali Purusha to influence the citizens of his kingdom who
are strictly following the religious principles.
He didn't want Kali to influence him to become irreligious.
So he gave Kali Purusha four places.
Now Kali Purusha actually to be indicated that Kali Purusha has entered the kingdom
of Pariksit.
That in the next words that he saw in Pariksit Maharaj's kingdom because he was ruling very
strictly.
There were no places where these activities were going on.
The people were protected against the influence of his sinful acts.
Hmm.
So.
Hmm.
So Śrīla Prabhupāda says if there are some people who are addicted to such habits,
for them what is the way out of you know these sinful activities.
So Prabhupāda says those who are addicted to these irreligious habits may be regulated
by the injunctions of the scripture.
As I mentioned in the previous session.
Part two.
same words discussion of part 2 the previous session that in the Shastras there is a concession
given for Tamsic people that they may be regulated in drinking liquor or eating meat or indulging
in sex with women by Shastric injunctions so injunctions of the scriptures meant for
Tamsic people but in no circumstances should such people who are addicted to these habits
be encouraged by the government or the state or the king never should there be any freedom given
to indulge in unrestrictedly so proper says in other words the state should never encourage any
of these activities they should categorically stop all sorts of gambling drinking prostitution
falsity and for that eradicating these sinful activities from the state proper says the
government
or the the state may introduce the principles of religion in the following manner he gives
recommendations Srila Prabhupada gives recommendations number one the first recommendation is
two compulsory fasting days in a month if not more to practice austerity everyone should practice
austerity and for that what they should do they should fast two compulsory days in a month so
Prabhupada says even from the economic point of view such two fasting days in a month in the
state will save tons of food and the system will also act very favorably on the general health of
the citizens this is particularly the recommendation in the scriptures of fasting on Ekadashi
to
twice a month the 11th day in the lunar calendar Shukla Paksha and Krishna Paksha Ekadashi twice a
month lunar month everybody should fast Ekadashi is a vrata meant for everyone they should fast
means fast from grains so this way they'll be practicing austerity because of which they will
not be influenced by
Kali Kali Purusha or Kali Yuga the evil influence of this age they will not be influenced and even
from the economic point of view the state will save so much of grains and even on the general
health of the citizens such fasting will help them to improve their health
fasting is the best way of improving one's health at least twice a month as recommended in the
scriptures then the second recommendation here is that there must be compulsory marriage of young
boys and girls attaining 24 years of age and 16 years of age respectively that means boys when
they reach 24 years of age they should compulsorily get married and girls when they reach 16 years of
age they should get compulsory married why is this recommendation of compulsory marriage
because it's very natural for young boys and girls to mix with each other but they should not mix
without being properly married that is the danger of mixing free mixing so Prabhupada says there is
no harm in co-education in the schools and colleges provided the boys and girls are duly
married and in case there is any intimate connection between a male and female and
male and female student they should be married properly without illicit relation
that means mixing between a boy and a girl is only allowed if they are married otherwise it
should not be allowed

the divorce act is encouraging prostitution and this should be abolished formerly in the Vedic culture there was nothing like divorce in the entire Vedic scripture there is no mention of divorce so there should be no government encouragement or government license for divorce so that is the divorce act has to be abolished.
So that is the divorce act has to be abolished.
So that is the divorce act has to be abolished.
That is what Prabhupada's recommendation is to avoid illicit connection with women.
The third recommendation Srila Prabhupada gives is the citizens of the state must give
in charity up to 50% of their income for the purpose of creating a spiritual atmosphere
in the state or in human society both individually and collectively.
You see that people's earning money they earn should be utilized properly so that there
is a good atmosphere in the spiritual atmosphere is created in the state or the human society.
Why because unless there is a proper atmosphere.
It is difficult to.
encourage people to practice some basic principles what are recommended in the in the Bhagavatam
also they should preach the principles of Bhagavatam the state should encourage preaching
the principles of Bhagavatam by five different methods principles of Bhagavatam can be preached
by the first one karma yoga or doing everything for the satisfaction of the Lord please explain
the third chapter of Bhagavad Gita karma yoga means whatever work one does wonder does it as

sacrifice to the supreme law that's called yajna so karma yoga means performing all work as

Lee at home or at places of worship Sankirtan yajna specifically
Kirtan yajna means the one who is doing all the work for the satisfaction of the Lord
kirtana hari kirtana chanting of the glories of the Lord congregation Lee all gathered together
people gathered together at home or in places of worship and they perform this kirtana hari

bhagavata's should be should be actually given all kinds of service serve the bhagavata's bhagavata's

consciousness these five recommendations for preaching the
principles of bhagavata are given by taught by sri che didn't even half of the group still

this whole atmosphere will be completely saturated with God consciousness we will talk about

heads of state so that they can eradicate the sinful activities and also bring about
a God conscious atmosphere in the state so that there is no corruption, there is no illicit
